intro: Chisocheton paohaniana, commonly known as the Paohaniana chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in humid, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
